001package zemeckis;
002
003import grim.annotations.OmitClinit;
004import grim.annotations.OmitSymbol;
005import java.util.Objects;
006import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
007import javax.annotation.Nullable;
008import org.jetbrains.annotations.TestOnly;
009import static org.realityforge.braincheck.Guards.*;
010
011/**
012 * Processing unit responsible for executing tasks.
013 */
014@OmitClinit
015public final class VirtualProcessorUnit
016{
017  /**
018   * A human consumable name for node. It should be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns
019   * true and <tt>null</tt> otherwise.
020   */
021  @OmitSymbol( unless = "zemeckis.enable_names" )
022  @Nullable
023  private final String _name;
024  /**
025   * The executor responsible for selecting and invoking tasks.
026   */
027  @Nonnull
028  private final Executor _executor;
029
030  /**
031   * Create the processor unit.
032   *
033   * @param executor the associated task executor.
034   */
035  VirtualProcessorUnit( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull final Executor executor )
036  {
037    if ( Zemeckis.shouldCheckApiInvariants() )
038    {
039      apiInvariant( () -> Zemeckis.areNamesEnabled() || null == name,
040                    () -> "Zemeckis-0002: VirtualProcessorUnit passed a name '" + name + "' but " +
041                          "Zemeckis.areNamesEnabled() is false" );
042    }
043    _name = Zemeckis.areNamesEnabled() ? Objects.requireNonNull( name ) : null;
044    _executor = Objects.requireNonNull( executor );
045    _executor.init( activationFn -> VirtualProcessorUnitsHolder.activate( this, activationFn ) );
046  }
047
048  /**
049   * Return the name of the VirtualProcessorUnit.
050   * This method should NOT be invoked unless {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and will throw an
051   * exception if invariant checking is enabled.
052   *
053   * @return the name of the VirtualProcessorUnit.
054   */
055  @OmitSymbol( unless = "zemeckis.enable_names" )
056  @Nonnull
057  public String getName()
058  {
059    if ( Zemeckis.shouldCheckApiInvariants() )
060    {
061      apiInvariant( Zemeckis::areNamesEnabled,
062                    () -> "Zemeckis-0003: VirtualProcessorUnit.getName() invoked when Zemeckis.areNamesEnabled() is false" );
063    }
064    assert null != _name;
065    return _name;
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Queue task for execution and enable the executor for activation if necessary.
070   * The task must not be already queued.
071   *
072   * @param name A human consumable name for the task. It should be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and <code>null</code> otherwise.
073   * @param task the task.
074   * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
075   */
076  @Nonnull
077  public Cancelable queue( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull final Runnable task )
078  {
079    return getExecutor().queue( name, task );
080  }
081
082  @Nonnull
083  Executor getExecutor()
084  {
085    return _executor;
086  }
087
088  @OmitSymbol( unless = "zemeckis.enable_names" )
089  @Nonnull
090  @Override
091  public String toString()
092  {
093    return Zemeckis.areNamesEnabled() ? getName() : super.toString();
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Interface via which the {@link VirtualProcessorUnit} executes tasks.
098   * The executor is responsible for activating the underlying {@link VirtualProcessorUnit} when required.
099   * Each time the {@link VirtualProcessorUnit} is activated it will use callback to talk to executor
100   * and the executor is responsible for selecting and executing tasks until it decides to return control
101   * to the {@link VirtualProcessorUnit}.
102   */
103  interface Executor
104  {
105    /**
106     * Initialize the executor passing in the context associated with the underlying {@link VirtualProcessorUnit}.
107     *
108     * @param context the context represent the associated {@link VirtualProcessorUnit}.
109     */
110    void init( @Nonnull Context context );
111
112    /**
113     * Reset state of executor.
114     * This is only used from within the test framework.
115     */
116    @TestOnly
117    void reset();
118
119    /**
120     * Queue task for execution and enable the executor for activation if necessary.
121     * The task must not be already queued.
122     *
123     * @param name A human consumable name for the task. It should be non-null if {@link Zemeckis#areNamesEnabled()} returns true and <tt>null</tt> otherwise.
124     * @param task the task.
125     * @return the {@link Cancelable} instance that can be used to cancel execution of the task.
126     */
127    @Nonnull
128    Cancelable queue( @Nullable String name, @Nonnull Runnable task );
129
130    /**
131     * Queue task for execution next. The executor is not activated. The task must not be already queued.
132     *
133     * @param task the task.
134     */
135    void queueNext( @Nullable final String name, @Nonnull Runnable task );
136
137    /**
138     * Activate the executor.
139     */
140    void activate();
141  }
142
143  @FunctionalInterface
144  interface ActivationFn
145  {
146    /**
147     * Callback method invoked by {@link Context#activate(ActivationFn)} to process tasks.
148     */
149    void invoke();
150  }
151
152  /**
153   * Interface representing {@link VirtualProcessorUnit} passed to {@link Executor} during initialization.
154   * This interface is designed to allow the {@link Executor} to activate the {@link VirtualProcessorUnit}
155   * when it needs to execute tasks.
156   */
157  interface Context
158  {
159    /**
160     * Activate the associated {@link VirtualProcessorUnit}.
161     * This method MUST only be called if there is no {@link VirtualProcessorUnit} unit currently activated.
162     * The activation will set the "current" VPU for the duration of the activation and invoke the
163     * {@link ActivationFn#invoke()} function passed into the method.
164     *
165     * @param activationFn the function passed to process tasks.
166     */
167    void activate( @Nonnull ActivationFn activationFn );
168  }
169}
